column4: anyone know how to get stage6 to work with Ubuntu 64? MediaPlayerConnectivity doesn't work...
what is stage6 ?
its a video hosting site that hosts videos in Xvid.
I'm trying to run it through tvlinks.
are you using a player in ff to do this ? which one ?
yeah. I've tried VLC, gxine and totem.
not as a plugin in ff I take it , well you still hve mplayer to try out
and its divx not xvid. JoCol just corrected me.
doesn't matter to me,  I'm just trying to figure out if you are streaming in a stand alone player or using a Firefox plugin
its a plugin that directs the stream to a stand alone player.
and switching to Mplayer just killed it off.
ic, I think,  well try giving mplayer a shot it's pretty good,  you might also want to ask the ppl in the various channels for the players you tried
i was more thinking that its probably because i'm using ubuntu 64 bit because it worked with 32 bit.
64 bit has several issues, we generaly tell ppl to use the 32bit versions unless they NEED a 64 bit os
unfortunately i've been using the 64 bit for somewhere around 4 months now... I don't want to switch for no reason.
check the forum for info on using firefox 32 bit in the 64 bit os,  it might give hyou a clue on how to get the 32 bit libs needed to run the plugin you need
i'm running the 32 bit version of Iceweasel..
then try and figure out what the libs that you need are to run that pluggin and get the 32 bit ones  , that's the best I can do for you
would the error from gxine help? it says that the xine engine failed to start.
and fails to find the file.
It wouldn'T help me figure it out , try reinstalling
ok.... I guess i'll just avoid stage6. I'm not in a position to reinstall without any kind of serious time loss.
you could dual boot , jsut make another partiton for 32 bit and use the same /home
currently i dual boot with windows. but I need to use linux currently so i don't worry about it too much. Its just one of those things i wish i had.
